title: Secure Connection Failed BS
content: Just pointing out the idiocy of this software... despite having tabs with multiple pages of the same host website open, Muppet-Zilla FireFux starts giving me the old Secure Connection Failed rubbish. Take the link, open it in public of MFF, it opens fine. Even a page that was open fine, try to open a link it, Secure Connection Failed rubbish. Hit the back key, A PAGE THAT WAS OPENED, then Secure Connection Failed rubbish. Yet in CCLeaner, Vivaldi, Chrome, Edge, no issues. So, I guess the message in that is clear - uninstall MFF, never install again. Good to know.

title: Firefox uses large amounts of memory that bring everything to a halt
content:
Since the last update (earlier this week) firefox uses large amounts of memory. It shows in the windows task manager 20 and more instances of firefox being open and one of them using 85%-90% of the available memory. I looked up help articles regarding this issue and one of them mentioned to "Delete content-prefs.sqlite file". When I do that it will help for a short period of time but then the issue is happening again. I'm using Windows 11 64 bit.

I'd appreciate some advice on how to deal with this.

title: PROBLEMI DI APERTURA SOLO CON FIREFOX DEL SITO ILCORSARONERO.LINK
content:
Ciao, dopo qualche mese in cui credevo ci fosse un problema al sito ilcorsaronero.link, mi sono reso conto si tratti di un problema solo di firefox. Il tentativo di apertura, infatti, va a vuoto e si interrompe con la schermata

"Tempo per la connessione esaurito

Si è verificato un errore durante la connessione a ilcorsaronero.link. 

   Il sito potrebbe essere non disponibile o sovraccarico. Riprovare fra qualche istante.    Se non è possibile caricare alcuna pagina, controllare la connessione di rete del computer.    Se il computer o la rete sono protetti da un firewall o un proxy, assicurarsi che Firefox abbia i permessi per accedere al Web."

In realtà, me ne sono reso conto aprendo il sito su smartphone android collegato alla stessa rete wifi, successivamente ho tentato con microsoft edge e anche li funziona. Così ho tentato le seguenti, svariate, potenziali soluzioni su firefox:

  • ripristino firefox
  • cancellazione totale cookie e cache
  • disattivazione del proxy dalle impostazioni del pc (prima che mi rendessi conto che su edge il sito apre)
  • selezionando "nessun proxy" dalle impostazioni firefox
  • disabilitando ipv6 e dns dalla finestra "about:config"

non so cos'altro tentare. Ho notato, però, che mentre su firefox si blocca per problemi di sicurezza, su edge viene considerato sicuro. Allego immagini. Qualcuno può spiegarmi? Grazie
creator: murgia78

title: link em arquivo pdf
content:
Ao abrir um arquivo PDF no Mozilla FireFox os link´s dentro deste arquivo não ficam disponíveis, que configuração devo fazer para que o link dentro de um arquivo PDF aberto no Mozilla possa estar disponível.

O mesmo arquivo pdf aberto em outro navegador no computador funciona, testei no Chrome e no Edde, nos dois os links dentro do arquivo pdf estavam disponíveis para aceitar o click.

Certo de poder contar com a colaboração de todos, agradeço.

creator: reedhedges

title: How can I save the login details for multiple subdomains on the same domain? Firefox is treating them all as the same site.
content:
I've seen other people ask this question, and the stock answer appears to be: a) They may be different subdomains, but they're the same site. b) Just add an extra bit on the end of each user name so you can get at the correct one.

Unfortunately...

a) No they are most definitely not the same site: myFirstClientsDevSite.mytestdomain.com mySecondClientsDevSite.mytestdomain.com myThirdClientsDevSite.mytestdomain.com myFirstClientsUATSite.mytestdomain.com mySecondClientsUATSite.mytestdomain.com myThirdClientsUATSite.mytestdomain.com

You see the problem? Firefox treats all those sites as being "the same site", even though they patently are not.

b) I'm working with a lot more than three clients. Plus, that suggestion is basically "we admit that our product is broken, here's a work-around that a few people may be able to use".

And finally: I'm pretty sure that Firefox used to be able to discriminate between subdomains, so the question isn't so much "how can I get it to work", as "why was it taken away in the first place".
creator: niall.jackson

title: 'Home' and "PgUp/Dn' buttons not working - Thinkpad
content:
Hi,

Just installed Firefox (again) as I want to move away from Chrome/Edge. Overall I like it but having the following problems...

The 'Home' key on the top of my Thinkpad no longer functions. When using Chrome or Edge, clicking on 'Home' brings me to the top of the web page I'm looking at. Very handy.

For scrolling long pages, 'PgUp' and 'PgDn' are useful for scrolling sections at time.

But in Firefox, none of these are working properly. the 'Home button does nothing at all. I have used 'Fn+Left' and this works sometimes, other times it does nothing.

The Page Up and Down keys are hit and miss. Sometimes the Page Down button will take me to the bottom of the page, while the 'PageUp' will take me up for a section or two and then stop working.

I'd really like to stick to Firefox but this functionality is important for me and it's very annoying not having it working properly.

Any tips or help will be appreciated.

Thanks, B
creator: bmulkerns
